Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Uniform spherical, crystalline, mesoporous structure with ordered channels, formed from 2D stacked layers.

Other Information.Additional Info: Effectively excluded by the restricted-access mesopore channels, allowing smaller peptides to pass through.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption based on strong hydrophobic interaction within restricted-access mesopores; smaller molecule can pass.

Other Information.Additional Info: Targeted for highly efficient and selective enrichment; adsorption capacity of 150 mg/g.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on restricted-access mesopore channels for size exclusion of macromolecules, combined with hydrophobic interactions for selective peptide enrichment.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Excellent size-exclusion effect against proteins; High-efficiency FGFGF enrichment (150 mg/g adsorption capacity); Rapid adsorption equilibrium (within 5 min) for peptides; C-peptide detection at 0.1 fmol/μL (S/N > 3).

Other Information.Additional Info: Uniform spherical COFs synthesized at room temperature; Size-controllable from nanometer to micrometer scale; Ultrahigh surface area (e.g., 1624 m2/g for 450 nm spheres); Good crystallinity, chemical, and thermal stability; Strong hydrophobicity (contact angle ~102°).
